item.title: Speeding up text pattern searching and sorting in PostgreSQL
item.description: Introduction Suppose you have a table with records that you want to be searchable by a textual attribute, such as name or title. You also need to sort those records in a certain way that is not necessarily linked to the name or title - for example, you want to display the most recent records, or the most popular ones, first. After a certain period, the table has grown in size and search has become very slow, so you need to speed it up somehow.

item.title: About
item.description: About me I’ve been a professional software developer for over 11 years. I’ve started off as a junior web developer tinkering with websites, later doing some application development, but for the past several years I’ve been doing mostly server-side and database development. My roots in software development go way back to the end of elementary school, when I’ve discovered QBASIC and Pascal. In my lifetime, I’ve put my hands on several programming languages and tools - I’ve built desktop apps, web sites, web apps, system integrations, and even some mobile games.
